context.p: To install on a Unix / Linux server:

step.cmd: Install on the server and make sure the script is executable and the installation directory is in the PATH of the users that need to use the application.
Make sure you allocate sufficient memory to by setting an appropriate value for the -Xmx parameter in the .sh startup script.
step.info: The default value of the -Xmx parameter is 512 MB. To avoid performance issues with large documents, you may need to adjust it.

step.cmd: Make sure the X server processes located on the workstations allow connections from the server host. For this, use the xhost command.
Start telnet (or ssh) on the server host.
Start an xterm process with the display parameter set on the current workstation. For example: xterm -display workstationip:0.0.

Start by typing sh oxygen.sh
sh oxygenAuthor.sh sh oxygenDeveloper.sh
sh syncroSVNClient.sh from the command line. This file is located in the installation folder.
